body: @rmlarsen Passing b and output as `Tensor` instead of `TTypes<T,NDIM>::Tensor` will solve this. But I'm not sure whether this is proper, as when I read other codes, people tend to pass parameters as `TTypes<T,NDIM>::Tensor`. I'm not sure if there is some reason behind it that I am not aware of.
body_html: @rmlarsen Passing b and output as Tensor instead of TTypes<T,NDIM>::Tensor will solve this. But I'm not sure whether this is proper, as when I read other codes, people tend to pass parameters as TTypes<T,NDIM>::Tensor. I'm not sure if there is some reason behind it that I am not aware of.
